language.name: Language
language.desc: Select the language for the plugin interface.

showRecordRibbonIcon.name: Show record button in ribbon
showRecordRibbonIcon.desc: Add a ribbon icon to record wordflows to periodic notes. Reload plugin to take effect.

ignoredFolders.name: Ignored folders
desc: Files inside these folders (or subfolders) will not be tracked.
Enter the excluded folder pathes separated by comma ',' or linebreaks.
Recommend to reload plugin after changing this setting.
Folder format validation:

validation.invalid: ⚠ Folder: "{folder}" is not found in Obsidian.

ignoredTags.name: Ignored tags
desc: Files containing any one of these tags in Frontmatter (YAML) will not be tracked.
Enter the excluded tags separated by comma ',' or linebreaks.
Recommend to reload plugin after changing this setting.

noteThreshold.name: Threshold for notes to record in edit mode
desc: Select a requirement for notes to be recorded in live preview and source mode.
Require edits means you should at least type anything or delete anything, even just a space.
Require focus time means you should leave the note under edit mode over 1 minute.
If require none above, the recorder will track all files you opened under edit mode.

options.ent: require both edits and focus time
options.eot: require either edits or focus time

noteToRecord.name: Notes to record while quiting editing mode
desc: Select the behavior when switching a note from editing mode to reading mode.
Editing mode includes live preview and source mode.
If recording current note only, other notes may not be automactically recorded if you don't manually record.

options.all: current and other notes in edit mode

autoRecordInterval.name: Automatic recording interval
desc: Set the interval in seconds, influencing when the plugin would record all tracked notes and to periodic notes.
Set to 0 to disable.

resetSettings.name: Reset all settings
resetSettings.desc: Reset all settings to the default value.

currentRecorder.name: Current recorder
desc: Select which recorder configuration to edit.
You can add new recorders to save different sets of statistics to different locations.

confirmations.deleteRecorder: Are you sure you want to remove "{name}"?

folder.name: Periodic note folder
desc: Toggle the button to enable dynamic folder. Disabled by default.
Specify the block for the folder of daily notes or weekly note.
folder.dynamicEnabled: Your current periodic note folder looks like this:
folder.dynamicDisabled: Your current periodic note folder looks like this:
folder.confirmToggle:
Please make sure that: 
	1. You will adjust the periodic note folder after toggling dynamic folder. Example formats are as followed: 
		If dynamic folder is enabled, the moment format must be used: 
			[MonthlyLogs/]MM-YYYY
		If dynamic folder is disabled, a folder path must be used: 
			Logs/MonthlyLogs 
	2. Do not forget to do the same changes to other recorders if you want them to record in the same folder!

format.name: Periodic note format

segments: Set the file name (in {link0}) for newly created daily notes or weekly note.

format.preview: Your current periodic note looks like this:

templatePlugin.name: Template plugin
desc: Set the template plugin you use to apply template to new created periodic notes.
Currently, only support the templates of core plugin "Templates".
If you are using community plugin "Templater", please use the folder template feature of "Templater".
If you do not need to apply template, kindly use the "default" option.

filePath.name: Template file path
desc: Set the file path for the template file to be applied.
Currently, only support the templates of core plugin "Templates".
If you are using community plugin "Templater", please use the folder template feature of "Templater".

dateFormat.name: Template file date format
dateFormat.desc: {{date}} in the template file will be replaced with this value.
dateFormat.preview: Your current syntax looks like this:

timeFormat.name: Template file time format
timeFormat.desc: {{time}} in the template file will be replaced with this value.
timeFormat.preview: Your current syntax looks like this:

recordType.name: Record content type
recordType.desc: Select a type of content to record on specified notes.

segments: Modified the syntax with '${}' syntax, see {link0} for supported string interpolation expressions.

insertPlace.name: Insert to position
desc: Insert to this position if no previous record exist.
If using a custom position, the start position and end position must exist and be unique in periodic note!
If using yaml position, the records will be inserted into the frontmatter of the periodic note.

startPosition.name: Start position
startPosition.desc: The records should be inserted after this content. Content between start position and end position would be replaced during recording.

endPosition.name: End position
endPosition.desc: The records should be inserted before this content. Content between start position and end position would be replaced during recording.

sortBy.name: Sort by
sortBy.desc: Select a type of variables to add recording items in a sequence.

timeFormat.name: Last modified time format
timeFormat.desc: Set the format of '${lastModifiedTime}' to be recorded on notes.
timeFormat.preview: Your current syntax looks like this:

idleInterval.name: Idle interval
desc: Interval in minutes when the timer in status bar will pause when idled for a period of time.
Any document clicking, outline clicking or editing behavior will refresh the timer from idling.

useSecondInWidget.name: Show second in widget pane (beta)
desc: Display seconds together with minute in the widget pane.
Will not affect existing data currently.
Required to reload the plugin once changed.

enableOnLoad.name: Enable Widget on loading
enableOnLoad.desc: Enable the side pane widget when plugin loads.

showRibbonIcon.name: Show widget reveal button in ribbon
showRibbonIcon.desc: Add a ribbon icon to reveal widget and refresh the widget content.

switchToFieldOnFocus.name: Switch to this field on focus mode
desc: When start focusing, this reading time field will be automatically switched in the widget.
Only the reading time field in your recording syntax is supported.
Reading time field includes: "${readTime}" and "${readEditTime}".

colorGroupLightness.name: Random color group lightness
colorGroupLightness.desc: Specify the lightness from 0-100 in hsl to generate random colors for file entries.

colorGroupSaturation.name: Random color group saturation
desc: Specify the saturation from 0-100 in hsl to generate random colors for file entries.
You can use space " " to separate numbers to offer multiple options.
If the current saturation options below does not change, the input should be invalid.

enableMobile.name: Enforce status bar display in mobile
desc: Enforce the status bar of wordflow tracker to show up in mobile devices.
If you have other css snippets do the same, they may be overwriten.

segments: Customize the content displayed in the status bar for different modes.
Use ${} syntax to insert dynamic values like ${editedWords}, ${editTime}, ${readTime}, etc.

readingMode.name: Content in reading mode
desc: Content to display when in reading/preview mode.
Supported variables: ${readTime}, ${docWords}, etc.

editMode.name: Content in editing mode
desc: Content to display when in live preview or source mode.
Supported variables: ${editTime}, ${editedWords}, ${editedTimes}, etc.

recordWordflows.name: Record wordflows from edited notes to periodic note

revealWidget.name: Reveal and refresh wordflow tracker widget
